article.headline: Arizona 93, N. Colorado 70
article.story: TUCSON, Ariz. -- Derrick Williams scored 15 points to lead four Arizona players in double figures as the Wildcats defeated Northern Colorado 93-70 Sunday in the IBN Sports Las Vegas Invitational. Williams, a sophomore, also had a game-high eight rebounds as the Wildcats started 3-0 for the first time in eight seasons. Kyle Fogg and Solomon Hill each scored 11 points and MoMo Jones added 10 for Arizona. Chris Kaba led the Bears (2-1) with 15 points. Northern Colorado never led as Arizona scored the game's first eight points and stretched the lead to 57-31 by halftime. Arizona's 2002-03 team, coached by Lute Olson, won its first five games and reached the Elite Eight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
